text: Stuck with it for life Ive been diagnosed with Tourettes officially for at least   years now  When I get anxious or sad  which I have since I was nine  my body fights myself My arms outstretched to hit myself  my neck whips around violently  often either connecting with an object or whiplash causing pain  I click loudly like a zombie from the last of us and cannot have conversations with new intimidating people without slurred words  My memory also is slipping  A noticeable change in brain development ever since my two attempts at overdoses from strong painkillers and alcohol I know im stuck with this for life  I knew this back in high school  when I attempted to OD as to get away from the feeling and hope I d never wake up I dont know how to look forward anymore  Living in a new state with my childhood friends didnt help  Meeting a girl I consider to love didnt help  The continued support of my family only burdens me with guilt Im not close  Im not in need of medical attention and my feelings seem to ebb and flow so im not concerned for my safety  But I do realise how quickly my mind seems to change How do you get over something that affects you every waking moment  How do you stop thinking of thoughts that are compulsions themselves
